qas.question: What is the definition of the current I(t) through any component in an electric circuit?

answers.text: the rate of flow of a charge Q(t) passing through it

qas.question: For each electron that departs the positive plate, how many electrons build up on the negative plate?

answers.text: one electron accumulates on the negative plate

qas.question: To what is the charge on the electrodes of a capacitor equal to?
To what is the charge on the electrodes of a capacitor proportional to?
When calculating the integral to determine the charge on the electrodes of a capacitor, what does the constant of integration that must be added represent?

plausible_answers.text: rate of flow of a charge Q(t) passing through it,

qas.question: What is the definition of the current P(t) through any component in an electric circuit?

plausible_answers.text: one electron accumulates on the negative plate

qas.question: For each electron that departs the negative plate, how many electrons build up on the negative plate?
To what is the charge on the electrodes of a capacitor not equal to?
To what is the charge on the electrodes of a capacitor disproportional to?
what does the constant of integration that must never be added represent?

context: I (t) hiện tại qua bất kỳ thành phần nào trong mạch điện được định nghĩa là <a0_0> các <b5_0> tốc độ dòng chảy của một điện tích Q (t) đi qua nó <a0_0/> , <b5_0/> nhưng các chi phí thực tế — các electron - không thể đi qua lớp điện môi của một tụ điện.
